description: EPA defines the method detection limit as 'the minimum concentration of a substance that can be measured and reported with 99% confidence that the analyte concentration is greater than zero and is determined from analysis of a sample in a given matrix containing the analyte.'
Threshold above which a measurement result is unlikely to result from a true value of zero
The measure of inherent detection capability of a measurement process.
The measure of the quantification capability of a measurement process. This value indicates the level at which the measurement process has a relative standard deviation of 0.1.
